Argument validation

Source: R/argcheck.R
checks.Rd

  • check_type checks if argument has correct class

  • check_function checks if argument is a function

  • check_numeric checks if argument is numeric

  • check_positive checks if argument is positive

  • check_non_negative checks if argument is non-negative

  • check_positive_all checks if argument has only positive values

  • check_non_negative_all checks if argument has only non-negative values

  • check_integer_all checks if argument has only integer values

  • check_interval checks if argument is inside a given interval

  • check_not_null checks if argument is not null

  • check_false checks if argument is false or zero

  • check_length checks if argument has given length

  • check_length_1_or checks if argument has given length or length 1

  • check_length_geq checks if argument has at least a given length

  • check_lengths checks if two arguments have equal length

  • check_in_data checks that variable exists in a data frame

  • check_all_leq checks that argument has values less than equal to given maximums, elementwise

  • check_not_named checks that names(arg) is NULL

  • check_named checks that length of names(arg) is greater than zero

  • check_dim checks that arg has expected number of dimensions

  • check_null checks that arg is NULL

check_type(arg, allowed)

check_function(arg, arg_name)

check_numeric(arg)

check_positive(arg)

check_non_negative(arg)

check_positive_all(arg)

check_non_negative_all(arg)

check_integer_all(arg)

check_interval(arg, lower, upper)

check_not_null(arg)

check_null(arg, reason = NULL)

check_length(arg, expected)

check_length_1_or(arg, expected)

check_length_geq(arg, min_length)

check_lengths(a, b)

check_false(arg)

check_in_data(var_name, data)

check_all_leq(arg, maximums)

check_not_named(arg)

check_named(arg)

check_dim(arg, D)

Arguments

arg

An argument to check.
allowed

Allowed class names.
arg_name

argument name
lower

interval minimum
upper

interval maximum
reason

explanation why the argument should be NULL
expected

Expected length.
min_length

Minimum allowed length.
a

An argument to check.
b

An argument to check.
var_name

the variable to be searched for
data

a data frame
maximums

maximum allowed values for arg
D

expected number of dimensions

Value

TRUE if the check passes.

See also

Other argument checks: check_allowed()
